s.text: It is definitely true, as you say, that politicians turn the folks they refer to as Ordinary Americans into props.
It is definitely true, as you say, that politicians turn the folks they refer to as Ordinary Americans into props.
I'm reminded of the time in late '95 or early '96, during his belly-flop presidential bid, when Phil Gramm introduced Dickie Flatt to the world.
I couldn't help but work in a sports metaphor, which was the other maddening aspect of '96.
The great disappointment of the Bradley campaign has been the incessant use of basketball terminology by political reporters.
